DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Other Thalassemia Related Hemoglobin Allele Type Hemoglobin Allele Level Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric laboratory percentage value measured, assigned or computed related to the level of the other thalassemia related hemoglobin allele.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Other Thalassemia Related Hemoglobin Allele Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A group of hereditary hemolytic anemias in which there is decreased synthesis of one or more hemoglobin polypeptide chains. There are several genetic types with clinical pictures ranging from barely detectable hematologic abnormality to severe and fatal anemia._A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb._Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Other Thalassemia Relationship Hemoglobin Allele Type
Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A group of hereditary hemolytic anemias in which there is decreased synthesis of one or more hemoglobin polypeptide chains. There are several genetic types with clinical pictures ranging from barely detectable hematologic abnormality to severe and fatal anemia.:A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.:The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.:Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An inherited blood disorder characterized by a decreased synthesis of one of the polypeptide chains that form hemoglobin. Anemia results from this abnormal hemoglobin formation.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.

Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb._Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount._A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.

Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
